meanings.definition: In a direction contrary to the sun's course, considered as unlucky; counterclockwise.
meanings.sent1: The children danced withershins around the maypole, giggling all the way.
meanings.sent2: She turned the dial withershins to decrease the volume of the music.
meanings.sent3: The cat chased its tail withershins, trying to catch the elusive tip.
meanings.sent4: The old clock ticked withershins, as if time itself was running backwards.
meanings.sent5: The wind howled withershins, carrying whispers of ancient tales.

meanings.definition: In a direction contrary to the natural order; backwards or in reverse.
meanings.sent1: The car moved withershins down the one-way street, causing confusion among drivers.
meanings.sent2: He rewound the tape withershins to listen to the beginning of the song again.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally stirred the soup withershins, creating a culinary disaster.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts swirled withershins, retracing memories she thought she had forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed withershins, defying the usual path of the water.
